intro: Chrysophyllum holtzii, commonly known as the African cherry or wild mango, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
